articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Mongolian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Mongolian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Russian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Russian President
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of sympathy to Russian President V. V. Putin in connection with an airliner crash at Rostov-na-Donu Airport of Russia that caused many casualties.
					 The message expressed deep consolation and sympathy to the president and, through him, to the victims and their bereaved families.
					
					 It sincerely hoped that the sorrow of the bereaved families would be healed and peace would settle as early as possible.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to President of United Arab Emirates
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to President of United Arab Emirates
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of sympathy to Sheikh Halifa Bin Zayed Al-Nahayan, president of the United Arab Emirates, on Sunday over the unexpected crash of its passenger plane in Russia that claimed many casualties.
					 The message expressed deep condolences and sympathy to the president and, through him, to the victims and their bereaved families.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets to President of Namibia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets to President of Namibia
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Hage Geingob, president of the Republic of Namibia, on Monday on the occasion of the 26th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed the expectations and belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, sincerely wishing the Namibian president good health and happiness and its government and people bigger success in their work for progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Makes Field Survey of Rakwon Machine Complex, Ponghwa Chemical Factory
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Makes Field Survey of Rakwon Machine Complex, Ponghwa Chemical Factory
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made field surveys of the Rakwon Machine Complex and the Ponghwa Chemical Factory.
					 Going round various shops of the complex and the factory to learn in detail about the production, the premier encouraged the workers, scientists, technicians and officials who are performing unprecedented miracles and feats in the 70-day campaign.
					
					 He called on them to make once again great innovations and leap forward in the production of various castings and items of cooperative production by learning from the spirit and traits shown by the ten party members of Rakwon and thus successfully carry out the last instructions of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A consultative meeting held at the chemical factory discussed the measures for solving the issues arising in updating some production processes.
					
					 Meanwhile, the premier also went round various factories in Sariwon, Jongju, Kwaksan and Namsi where he called for fully supplying farm machine accessories.

articles.title: Congratulations to Lao People's Revolutionary Party
articles.content:
Congratulations to Lao People's Revolutionary Party
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Monday sent a congratulatory message to the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party on its 61st founding anniversary.
					 The message expressed pleasure over a lot of achievements made by the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and the fraternal Lao people to defend the gains of revolution, consolidate the people's democratic system and develop the country's economy.
					
					 It expressed conviction that traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties will grow stronger in their joint struggle for socialism.
					
					 It wished the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and the Lao people bigger success in their struggle for implementing the decisions of the 10th Party Congress under the leadership of General Secretary Bounnhang Vorachith.

articles.title: DPRK Embassy in Moscow Hosts Reception
articles.content:
DPRK Embassy in Moscow Hosts Reception
 Moscow, March 19 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Moscow hosted a reception on Thursday to mark the 67th anniversary of the signing of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and the Russian Federation.
					 Present there on invitation were officials of the government, Federal Assembly, political parties, organizations and institutions of Russia including  the Foreign Ministry, Ministry of Development of Far East, Ministry of Energy, State Duma, Party for Peace and Unity, Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, Chamber of Commerce and Industry, TASS and Interfax.
					
					 Present there were the ambassador and officials of the DPRK embassy.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before an art work depicting President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid homage to them.
					
					 They looked round the photos dealing with revolutionary exploits of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Meanwhile, receptions were given at the DPRK missions in Vladivostok and Khabarovsk on March 16 and 17.

articles.title: DPRK Team Leaves for 8th Asian Taekwon-Do Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Team Leaves for 8th Asian Taekwon-Do Championship
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Team led by Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee who doubles as chairman of the Asian Taekwon-Do Federation, left here Monday to participate in the 8th Asian Taekwon-Do Championship to be held in Kazakhstan.

articles.title: Output Goes Up at Thermal Power Plants in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Output Goes Up at Thermal Power Plants in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Electricity output is on the steady increase at thermal power plants in Pyongyang.
					 The Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex has daily produced 40 000 more kw of electricity than scheduled since the start of the 70-day campaign.
					
					 The Complex established a new production control system to run the generating equipment on a scientific basis.
					
					 The East Pyongyang Thermal Power Plant has carried out its daily production quota at 130 percent by shortening the period of boiler overhaul and making periodic and cyclic checkups of undifferentiated system in a responsible manner.

articles.title: Broad-gauge Railway Project Progresses Apace in DPRK
articles.content:
Broad-gauge Railway Project Progresses Apace in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The construction of Hyesan-Samjiyon broad-gauge railway is progressing apace in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 This project is aimed to spruce up Samjiyon County as befitting a center for education in the revolutionary traditions and provide better traffic conditions for visitors to the historic sites and battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Through a collective innovation movement, the builders finished the heading of hundreds of meters of railway tunnel in less than half a year.
					
					 According to data available, a work to lay railroad beds and build structures has been carried out over 90 percent and the construction for revetment, piers and extension of railway tunnel 85 percent.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Devotedly Defending Headquarters of Revolution
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Devotedly Defending Headquarters of Revolution 
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday editorially calls upon all the service personnel and people to consolidate the fortress for devotedly protecting the leader as firm as an iron wall and more dynamically wage the decisive battle to smash at a single blow the reckless moves of the enemies to attack the headquarters of the revolution.
					 The editorial says:
					
					 The headquarters of the revolution not only serves as a symbol of mightiness of Songun Korea and banner of all victories and honor but also represents the destiny and future of the service personnel and people of the DPRK.
					
					 We can not think about Korea, the life and happiness of the people without the leader as flowers cannot live without the sun. They regard it as their lifeblood to devotedly defend the leader and hold the headquarters of revolution dearer than their own lives as they cannot live even a moment without the care of the leader.
					
					 If anyone provokes the dignified supreme headquarters even a bit, the service personnel and people of the DPRK will mercilessly deal prompt blows at him or her without slight mercy, tolerance and patience.
					
					 Those who perpetrate hideous provocations to the dignity of the supreme leadership dearer to the Korean people than their own lives can never find any place safe from the deadly strike and merciless punishment by the service personnel and people to wipe out them wherever they are on the earth.
					
					 The world will clearly see what tremendous force and miracles the service personnel and people of the DPRK will demonstrate in a sacred struggle to devotedly protect the leader.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Enemies' Military Hysteria
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Enemies' Military Hysteria
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the nuclear carrier USS John C Stennis with 6 500 crewmen aboard entered into Pusan Port escorted by a destroyer, a cruiser, the 9th flying corps, the 21st destroyer flotilla and a lot of aggressor craft. 
					 Earlier, the warmongers kicked off the largest-ever joint landing drills in the Phohang area similar to the coastal area of the north with landing craft and offensive means involved.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 This reckless saber-rattling is, in fact, no more than the bluffing of the mentally weak aggressors and the last-ditch efforts of those at death's door.
					
					 We do not hide the fact that we are fully ready to fight an all-out war against the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 Our revolutionary armed forces have grown the strongest and all parts of the country have turned into a fortress.
					
					 Songun Korea is the only country with strong will and capability to mercilessly punish the U.S. in the world. And the battle for reunifying the country is a blitzkrieg for wiping out the enemy at a single blow by making deadly strategic strike at his sore point. 
					
					 Our strike is like a sharp dagger thrust into the hearts of the enemy and baptism of fire to bring doom to the enemy at a go.
					
					 Our punishment is stern and merciless.
					
					 This is to be meted out by history and justice and the legitimate right to be exercised by the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Warns Provocateurs of Deadly Blows
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Warns Provocateurs of Deadly Blows
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists revealed themselves that the drills for a nuclear war are aimed at "bringing down the social system in the DPRK," discarding even the smokescreen of "annual and defensive exercises". This is an outright provocation to the DPRK. Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The situation on the Korean peninsula has been pushed to the brink of a nuclear stand-off due to the U.S. imperialists' nuclear war racket. As a result, it is getting unpredictable and uncontrollable.
					
					 The U.S. is chiefly to blame for this grave situation.
					
					 It was the just self-defensive measure and the only right option for the DPRK to have had access to nuclear weapons of justice to protect peace on the Korean peninsula and the dignity and sovereignty of the nation.
					
					 Peace is not something to be presented by the imperialists and it can, therefore, be guaranteed only when one's own force is built up.
					
					 It is necessary to beat the nuclear-armed enemies with stronger nuclear weapons.
					
					 It is the just way of protecting peace and stability on the Korean peninsula to develop nukes both in quality and quantity and this is essential for protecting international justice under the present situation where injustice prevails and a weak country is bound to be mercilessly trampled down.
					
					 Should the enemies destroy even a single blade of grass or a single tree of the DPRK, it will mobilize all military strike means including nuclear weapons to deal deadly blows at them so that none of them may survive, warns the article.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Abusing Hacking Case for Campaign for Stifling DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Abusing Hacking Case for Campaign for Stifling DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Recently 10 odd world-famous information security businesses announced that their joint inquiry into the case of hacking into Sony Pictures Entertainment proved that it was engineered by a hackers group which has committed cyber terrorism against China, India, Japan and others since 2009.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Monday says:
					
					 The results of the inquiry brought to light the truth behind the base plot hatched by Washington to kick up the racket for stifling the DPRK after announcing the results of investigation called "north Korea's cyber terrorism" by deliberately linking the hacking case with it and misleading public opinion.
					
					 The hysterical row kicked up by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime against the DPRK with the above-said case as a momentum was an unprecedented political fraud aimed at tarnishing the high international prestige of the DPRK and realizing their wild ambition for stifling it at any cost.
					
					 The U.S. and the Park Geun Hye group of traitors are the worst tricksters and provocateurs in the world who resort to any means and method and any sinister plot to do harm to the DPRK and stifle it.
					
					 As the truth behind the above-said hacking case has been probed, the chief architects of the provocation deserve severe punishment.
					
					 Obama should retract his presidential executive order given to slap "additional sanctions" against the DPRK over the case and make an apology for his reckless criminal act to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK.
					
					 The Park Gune Hye group of traitors will have to pay dearly for its acts of treachery for having thrown the inter-Korean relations into catastrophe by toeing Washington's line, with the wild ambition for stifling the fellow countrymen in the north.

articles.title: Japan's Distortion of History under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Distortion of History under Fire
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People in an editorial on March 19 denounced Japan's shameless distortion of history.
					 The editorial said:
					
					 Among 35 kinds of Japanese textbooks dealing with social subjects which passed the screening on March 18, Tok Islets were marked as "part of the territory of Japan" in 27 kinds of history textbooks and the description that "the military was involved in drafting sexual slaves" was deleted from most of the textbooks.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime should scrap the wrong "agreement," though belatedly, and lodge a strong protest with the Japanese government keen on the lurch to the Right and distortion of history, the editorial urged.

articles.title: S. Korean People Protest U.S. Forces' War Exercises Bringing Pain to Them
articles.content:
S. Korean People Protest U.S. Forces' War Exercises Bringing Pain to Them
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Residents in Phochon City, Kyonggi Province who live near the drill ground of U.S. forces in south Korea complained about sufferings they were undergoing due to the war rehearsals of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces before the investigators of the Committee for People's Civic Rights on March 18, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 They demanded the authorities take measures against their sufferings as early as possible while staging demonstrations and rallies.
					
					 They demanded the authorities take a security measure as early as possible.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Youth Policy Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Youth Policy Denounced
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People in an editorial on March 17 noted that the young joblessness reached all-time high in February, adding this was an accurate assessment of the youth policy pursued by the regime. 
					 The regime attributed this to the seasonal reason and others, but it is not enough to explain the worsening youth employment, the paper noted, adding that Park Geun Hye should repent of her incompetence before blaming others and take into consideration the pain youth have to undergo.

articles.title: Russian Experts Term DPRK's Ballistic Rocket Launches Just
articles.content:
Russian Experts Term DPRK's Ballistic Rocket Launches Just
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Russian experts termed the ballistic rocket launching drills of the Strategic Force of the Korean People's Army just.
					 Alexander Zhebin, chief of the Korean Affairs Study Center of the Institute of the Far East under the Russian Academy of Sciences, when interviewed by Interfax on March 18, held that the ballistic rocket launches of the DPRK was a measure for countering the U.S.-south Korea joint military drills.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The people of the DPRK are showing their will to counter all acts they regard as hostile on the "tit-for-tat" principle.
					
					 The DPRK suggests that it would steadily take such measures, calling for an equality-based dialogue with the U.S.
					
					 As for the ballistic rocket launches, they will never strain the situation on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Some countries including those which have not yet been recognized as nuclear weapons states are routinely conducting rocket tests but they have never been faulted.
					
					 Igori Kortchenko, chief editor of the magazine Bezopasnosty Oborony commented as follows:
					
					 The ballistic rocket launches of the DPRK, in every case, serve as countermeasures against the provocative maneuvers of the U.S. and south Korea which are staging large-scale military drills in areas near the boundary with the DPRK.
					
					 The military threat being posed by the U.S. and south Korea is making Pyongyang enforce tougher foreign policies and lines.
					
					 To ease the tension, the U.S. and its allies should refrain from provoking the DPRK. What is clear is that the principle of co-existence of the north and the south of Korea should be provided and broad-based north-south political dialogue be resumed in order to ease the regional tensions.
					
					 Kalashnikov, first vice chairman of the international affairs committee of the State Duma, noted when interviewed by Ria Novosti:
					
					 I think the DPRK conducted ballistic rocket launches as it has become certain that the only way out is to bolster its own power while witnessing collapse of state systems in Libya, Syria, Iraq and various other countries. 
					
					 The present international order including international law was completely ruined. The DPRK's ballistic rocket launches will not threaten its neighboring countries.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Warmongers Urged to Stop Their Rash Acts
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Warmongers Urged to Stop Their Rash Acts
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China released a statement on March 17 in support of the special statement issued by the DPRK government, political parties and organizations.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean warmongers would be well advised to stop their reckless acts, well aware that it is the unshakable will of the army and people of the DPRK to deal merciless sledge hammer blows at the provocateurs who dare hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. 
					
					 The association and all Koreans in China will come out in the sacred campaign to devotedly defend the leader in order to mercilessly wipe out the aggressors by joining the service personnel and people in the homeland if the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers dare invade the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Brief Biography Posted by Austrian Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Brief Biography Posted by Austrian Organization on Its Website
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The brief biography of President Kim Il Sung was posed by the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and the DPRK on its website on March 14 on the occasion of his birth anniversary (the Day of the Sun).
					 The website carried a photo of the smiling President.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Jordan
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Jordan
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A Jordan preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed in Amman on March 15.
					 Marwan Sudah, chairman of the Arab Committee for Solidarity with Korean People and Supporting the Reunification of Korea in Jordan, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary career and exploits of the President from March 15 to April 15.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in German
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in German 
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed by the German Communist Party on March 17.
					 Torsten Schoevitz, chairman of the Communist Party of Germany, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events praising revolutionary exploits President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed for humankind and the greatness of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Denmark
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Denmark
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed in Copenhagen on March 16.
					 H. Jacobsen, member of the Leadership of the Communist Party in Denmark, and Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, were elected co-chairmen of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Kyrgyzstan
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary for President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan on March 15.
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.

articles.title: Russian Body Supports Korean People's Just Cause
articles.content:
Russian Body Supports Korean People's Just Cause
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK made public a statement on March 12 in support of the Korean people's just cause.
					 The statement said that the DPRK's nuclear weapons guarantee its sovereignty and independence, extending congratulations to the Korean people on their successes in developing miniaturized nuclear warhead.
					
					 It noted that the DPRK is steadily bolstering its nuclear deterrence against the imperialists' sanctions and pressure, sincerely hoping the Korean people would further increase the capabilities of the nuclear force and build an economic power at an early date.

articles.title: Japanese Bodies, Personages Demand Government Lift Independent Sanctions against DPRK
articles.content:
Japanese Bodies, Personages Demand Government Lift Independent Sanctions against DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Voices critical of the independent sanctions imposed by the Japanese authorities against the DPRK are mounting higher within Japan.
					 The Gunma Prefectural Society for Solidarity with the Korean Women in a letter of protest sent to Prime Minister Abe demanded the government lift at once the independent sanctions it applied against the DPRK over its launch of earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4 as it is unreasonable one escalating tensions in the region and dampening the desire of the people for peace.
					
					 The executive chairman of the Kinki Regional Headquarters of the All-Japan Construction and Transport Solidarity Trade Union branded the government's measure for independent sanctions as a mean act of advocating the story about "threat from the DPRK", promoting the building of a triangular military alliance among the U.S., Japan and south Korea and stifling the DPRK's economy.
					
					 Osaka co-representatives of the Citizens Solidarity Demanding Earlier Normalization of the Relations between Japan and the DPRK said it is quite natural that the DPRK dissolved the "special investigation committee", affirming that the honest implementation of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration and Stockholm agreement is the only way of solving the issue.
					
					 The executive chairman of the Kansai Region of the All-Japan Harbor Trade Union said that it is necessary for the government to make efforts for the conclusion of the DPRK-U.S. peace treaty and stop propagating the fiction about "threat from the DPRK" among the people.
					
					 The Shigoku Liaison Society for Japan-Korea Friendship urged the government to drop its hostile policy toward the DPRK and resume the talks for normalizing diplomatic relations with the DPRK.

articles.title: Japanese Organization Urges U.S. to Come out for Dialogue with DPRK
articles.content:
Japanese Organization Urges U.S. to Come out for Dialogue with DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A demonstration took place in front of the U.S. embassy in Tokyo on March 11 in protest against the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle 16 joint military drills kicked off by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces.
					 Present there were the chairman and members of Japan Committee for the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea.
					
					 The demonstrators termed the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle 16 an operation for invasion, drills for a preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 They handed a letter of protest to the U.S. embassy.
					
					 The letter referred to the scale and danger of the drills aimed to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK.
					
					 It urged the U.S. to immediately stop reckless war provocations and come out for concluding a peace treaty with the DPRK.

articles.title: Sri Lankan Organizations Demand Stop to U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Drills
articles.content:
Sri Lankan Organizations Demand Stop to U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Drills
Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Sri Lanka-People's Korea Friendship Association and the Sri Lanka Committee for the Reunification of Korea in a joint statement on March 13 demanded an immediate halt to the U.S.-south Korea joint military drills.
					 The Key Resolve and Foal Eagle 16 joint military drills are driving the situation on the Korean peninsula to the worst crisis, the joint statement said, and went on:
					
					 South Korea, a colony and military base of the U.S., has been reduced to the biggest nuclear base in the Far East.
					
					 The U.S. has frequently staged nuclear war drills with huge forces involved after introducing many nuclear weapons into south Korea.
					
					 A nuclear war on the Korean peninsula would bring a huge nuclear disaster to humankind.
					
					 The imperialist allied forces and the south Korean authorities are challenging the just cause of the people for independence, peace and social progress.
					
					 The peace-loving countries and progressives should get firmly united to struggle against the U.S.-south Korea joint military drills.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con embajador de Mongolia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con embajador de Mongolia
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, departio hoy en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con Manibadrakh Ganbold, embajador de Mongolia en la RPDC, quien le hizo una visita de despedida.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a presidente ruso
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a presidente ruso
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 20 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de la Federacion Rusa, Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, en relacion con que hubo gran perdida humana por el accidente de caida de un avion de pasajeros, ocurrido en el aeropuerto de Rostov-Na-Donu de Rusia.
					El remitente expresa profunda simpatia y condolencias al destinatario, y por su conducto, a las victimas  y sus familiares.
					
					Y desea de todo corazon que se eliminara cuanto antes la tristeza de las familiares de victimas y se implantara la estabilidad.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a presidente de Emiratos Arabes Unidos
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias a presidente de Emiratos Arabes Unidos
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 20 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de los Emiratos Arabes Unidos, Sheikh Halifa Bin Zayed Al-Nahayan, en relacion con que hubo gran perdida humana por el accidente inesperado de un avion de pasajeros de los Emiratos Arabes Unidos ocurrido en Rusia.
					El remitente expresa al destinatario profunda simpatia y condolencias, y por su conducto, a las victimas y sus familiares.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente irani
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente irani
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 20 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, Hassan Rouhani, con motivo del Ano Nuevo de Iran.
					En su misiva, el remitente desea que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises se ampliaran y se desarrollaran en la politica, la economia, la cultura y otros dominios y formula sinceros votos por mayores exitos en las labores del destinatario y su pueblo para el progreso y el desarrollo del pais.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju recorre varias fabricas
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju recorre varias fabricas
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, se cercioro en el terreno de las labores del Complejo de Maquinaria de Rakwon y de la Fabrica Quimica de Ponghwa.
					Recorriendo el taller de hierro fundido Sin Pho Hyang del Complejo, el otro de vaporizacion de dicha fabrica y otros lugares, el premier hizo detallado conocimiento del estado de produccion y estimulo a los obreros, cientificos, tecnicos y funcionarios quienes crean milagros y proezas sin precedentes en la campana de 70 dias.
					
					Enfatizo la necesidad de aprender el mundo espiritual y el estilo de lucha de 10 militantes del partido de Rakwon para registrar otra vez gran innovacion y gran salto en la produccion de diversas piezas fundidas y articulos en cooperacion, materializar asi los legados del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					En la reunion consultiva convocada en la Fabrica Quimica de Ponghwa se discutieron las medidas para dar solucion a los problemas que se presentan en la remodelacion de unas cadenas de produccion.
					
					Por otra parte, el premier recorrio las fabricas de piezas de tractor de Sariwon y Jongju, las Fabricas de Maquinas Agricolas de Remolque de Kwaksan y de Maquinas Ganaderas de Namsi, donde enfatizo la necesidad de suministrar suficientemente las piezas de maquinas agricolas.

articles.title: CC de PTC felicita 61o aniversario de fundacion de PPRL
articles.content:
CC de PTC felicita 61o aniversario de fundacion de PPRL
Pyongyang, 21 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea envio el dia 21 un mensaje de felicitacion al Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao, con motivo del 61o aniversario de fundacion del PPRL. 
					La misiva expresa el regocijo por el hecho de que el PPRL y el hermano pueblo laosiano alcanzan muchos exitos en la defensa de las conquistas de la revolucion, en el fortalecimiento del regimen popular democratico y en el desarrollo de la economia del pais. 
					
					Manifiesta la conviccion de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre el PTC y el PPRL se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas tambien en el futuro en la lucha comun por el socialismo. 
					
					Desea que bajo la orientacion del secretario general Bounnhang Vorachith, el PPRL y el pueblo laosiano alcancen grandes exitos en la materializacion de la resolucion del X Congreso del Partido.
